DataElement.preferredName: Doppler Ultrasound Diagnostic Imaging Portal Blood Circulation Assessment Status
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the status of a diagnostic imaging evaluation that uses sound waves (ultrasound)  applying the Doppler effect, with frequency-shifted ultrasound  reflections produced by moving targets (usually red blood cells) in the  bloodstream along the ultrasound axis in direct proportion to the  velocity of movement of the targets, to determine both direction and  velocity of blood flow in the portal vein, which enters the liver at the porta, and divides into capillaries after the manner of an artery.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Doppler Ultrasound Diagnostic Imaging Portal Blood Circulation Assessment
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to the diagnostic imaging evaluation that uses sound waves (ultrasound)  applying the Doppler effect, with frequency-shifted ultrasound  reflections produced by moving targets (usually red blood cells) in the  bloodstream along the ultrasound axis in direct proportion to the  velocity of movement of the targets, to determine both direction and  velocity of blood flow in the portal vein, which enters the liver at the porta, and divides into capillaries after the manner of an artery.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition:
Diagnostic imaging that uses sound waves (ultrasound)
applying the Doppler effect, with frequency-shifted ultrasound
reflections produced by moving targets (usually red blood cells) in the
bloodstream along the ultrasound axis in direct proportion to the
velocity of movement of the targets, to determine both direction and
velocity of blood flow.:Any method that uses a visual display of structural or functional patterns of organs or tissues for diagnostic evaluation..

Concepts.definition: Diagnostic imaging that uses sound waves (ultrasound) applying the Doppler effect, with frequency-shifted ultrasound reflections produced by moving targets (usually red blood cells) in the bloodstream along the ultrasound axis in direct proportion to the velocity of movement of the targets, to determine both direction and velocity of blood flow.
Any method that uses a visual display of structural or functional patterns of organs or tissues for diagnostic evaluation.

Property.preferredDefinition: Of or pertaining to a porta, especially the porta of the liver; as, the portal vein, which enters the liver at the porta, and divides into capillaries after the manner of an artery. Portal is applied to other veins which break up into capillaries; as, the renal portal veins in the frog. (On-line Medical Dictionary):The movement of blood to and from the heart and to the rest of the body's organs, tissues, and cells through the network of arteries, veins, and capillaries. (NCI):Examination of the body by auscultation, palpation, percussion, inspection, and olfaction.  (Taber's)

Concepts.definition: Of or pertaining to a porta, especially the porta of the liver; as, the portal vein, which enters the liver at the porta, and divides into capillaries after the manner of an artery. Portal is applied to other veins which break up into capillaries; as, the renal portal veins in the frog.
The movement of blood to and from the heart and to the rest of the body's organs, tissues, and cells through the network of arteries, veins, and capillaries. (NCI)

A systemic evaluation of the body and its functions using visual inspection, palpation, percussion and auscultation. The purpose is to determine the presence or absence of physical signs of disease or abnormality for an individual's health assessment.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: the status of a scan that was performed.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Being approximately average or within certain limits; conforming with or constituting a norm or standard or level or type or social norm.

Concepts.definition: Being approximately average or within certain limits; conforming with or constituting a norm or standard or level or type or social norm.
Deviating in any way from the state, position, structure, condition, behavior, or rule which is considered a norm.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Status; a condition or state at a particular time.

Concepts.definition: A condition or state at a particular time.

ValueDomain.origin: RTOG CRF:Radiation Therapy Oncology Group Case Report Form
